meanings.definition: Resembling or having the qualities of wax.
meanings.sent1: The ceraceous petals of the flower glistened in the sunlight.
meanings.sent2: The candle had a ceraceous feel to it, making it easy to mold.
meanings.sent3: The ceraceous statue looked like it could melt in the heat of the day.
meanings.sent4: Her skin had a ceraceous sheen, as if she had been sculpted from wax.
meanings.sent5: The ceraceous texture of the fruit made it seem artificial.

meanings.definition: Having a waxy appearance or texture.
meanings.sent1: The ceraceous crayons left a smooth mark on the paper.
meanings.sent2: The cheese had a ceraceous coating that preserved its freshness.
meanings.sent3: The ceraceous surface of the car made it look like a giant candle on wheels.
meanings.sent4: His voice had a ceraceous quality, smooth and malleable.
meanings.sent5: The ceraceous texture of the fabric made it waterproof and shiny.
